H0.text: what do they speak in norway. Nynorsk

H1.text: what do they speak in norway. Danish

H2.text: what do they speak in norway. Swedish

H3.text: what do they speak in norway. Bokmål

A4.text: Today there are two official forms of written Norwegian, Bokmål (Riksmål) and Nynorsk (Landsmål), each with its own variants.

A5.text: A 2005 poll indicates that 86.3% use primarily Bokmål as their daily written language, 5.5% use both Bokmål and Nynorsk, and 7.5% use primarily Nynorsk.

A6.text: Online dictionary search, both Bokmål and Nynorsk.

A7.text: Ordbøker og nettressurser Archived 16 December 2018 at the Wayback Machine – a collection of dictionaries and online resources (in Norwegian) from Språkrådet.

A8.text: Bokmål is by far the most used written form of Norwegian today, as it is adopted by 85% to 90% of the population in Norway.

A9.text: Danish never became the spoken language of the vast majority of the population.
